intro: Euphrasia brownii var. alpina, commonly known as the alpine eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Euphrasia brownii var. alpina is noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies for eye conditions and skin ailments.
